title: Update redux-form to version 6.0.2 🚀
body_text:
Hello lovely humans,
redux-form just published its new version 6.0.2.

  
    
      State
    
    
      Update 🚀
    
  
  
    
      Dependency
    
    
      redux-form
    
  
  
    
      New version
    
    
      6.0.2
    
  
  
    
      Type
    
    
      dependency
    
  

This version is not covered by your current version range.
Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though.
I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of redux-form.
Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update.
Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right?
Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work?
There is a collection of frequently asked questions and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. Let them know.
Good luck with your project ✨
You rock!
🌴

GitHub Release

Bug fix involving submission error not being cleared. #1654 #1641 Thanks, @ortex!
Fixed issue with the jsnext:main build. #1671 #1637 Thanks, @NotWoods!
Added props to handleSubmit call. #1639 #1629 Thanks, @olistic!
Up to 5x performance gains when reading deep objects. #1667 Thanks, @smirea!
A lot of documentation clean-up by @kevinzwh.

Thanks for all your help, guys.

The new version differs by 595 commits .

d41e010 Improved performance of getIn (#1667)
7e0c15e Replaced babel-preset-es2015 with babel-preset-es2015-no-commonjs (#1671)
9ab72b0 Add missing documentation on enableReinitialize in InitializeFromState example docs (#1681)
7cb660d Update index.js (#1676)
37d5c28 fix submit form after failing (#1654)
fb03d0a Add Source code links to API documentation & Add selectors section to api/README.md (#1656)
4038836 Add explanation on how custom props are given in Field & clarify props given by Field (#1663)
247e596 #1635 Replacing duplicated username with password in V6 example (#1638)
e6c5d79 Pass props to handleSubmit (#1639)
1c6ac42 Fix broken links & image in documentation (#1651)
3aec127 Remove deprecated reducer.normalize details from Reducer.md (#1652)
d6973dd fixed links in examples nav
562df28 fixed field array example readme
b7997ec fixed selectors docs. #1617
2f55d9e linked to older docs on README. #1621

There are 250 commits in total. See the full diff.

This pull request was created by greenkeeper.io.
Tired of seeing this sponsor message? ⚡️ greenkeeper upgrade
body:
Hello lovely humans, [redux-form](https://www.npmjs.com/package/redux-form) just published its new version 6.0.2.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency redux-form
New version 6.0.2
Type dependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of redux-form. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/releases/tag/v6.0.2)
  • Bug fix involving submission error not being cleared. #1654 #1641 Thanks, @ortex!
  • Fixed issue with the jsnext:main build. #1671 #1637 Thanks, @NotWoods!
  • Added props to handleSubmit call. #1639 #1629 Thanks, @olistic!
  • Up to 5x performance gains when reading deep objects. #1667 Thanks, @smirea!
  • A lot of documentation clean-up by @kevinzwh.

Thanks for all your help, guys.

--- The new version differs by 595 commits . - [`d41e010`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/d41e010b9197ffc167c6c08cafa9321d5436754c) Improved performance of getIn (#1667) - [`7e0c15e`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/7e0c15e5b731dfab4b5181dc0f9df795036b4c80) Replaced babel-preset-es2015 with babel-preset-es2015-no-commonjs (#1671) - [`9ab72b0`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/9ab72b0fc1dad7727742752ed7009977b227a4ed) Add missing documentation on `enableReinitialize` in InitializeFromState example docs (#1681) - [`7cb660d`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/7cb660df70d27800475fa8a93d515d0124da5a8f) Update index.js (#1676) - [`37d5c28`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/37d5c2800bde99f9c1062f3cd076e1baab084edd) fix submit form after failing (#1654) - [`fb03d0a`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/fb03d0a702bcdb2cc1065b5ba3121235683365d6) Add Source code links to API documentation & Add selectors section to api/README.md (#1656) - [`4038836`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/4038836544934ccfcabbe7be534d18476f9c4fb7) Add explanation on how custom props are given in Field & clarify props given by Field (#1663) - [`247e596`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/247e596e0657274ce9217b023251c64692f0cca4) #1635 Replacing duplicated username with password in V6 example (#1638) - [`e6c5d79`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/e6c5d79482e1954d9fc360a95ba8811e32a37809) Pass props to handleSubmit (#1639) - [`1c6ac42`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/1c6ac42d0145e838c6ca6a7b0993ff68453f0e88) Fix broken links & image in documentation (#1651) - [`3aec127`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/3aec1273c97dabc3fb0d0b8a72fe347bd1215103) Remove deprecated reducer.normalize details from Reducer.md (#1652) - [`d6973dd`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/d6973dd6d8541d60b9e21ce87ec152e29dd789ed) fixed links in examples nav - [`562df28`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/562df284bf1645ac9e433d0c5fce96543124bf63) fixed field array example readme - [`b7997ec`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/b7997ec274cc9c07fa9210f1c999c7cf93262852) fixed selectors docs. #1617 - [`2f55d9e`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/2f55d9edef47d62baa0ed7d590ad8f4833f7b81f) linked to older docs on README. #1621 There are 250 commits in total. See the [full diff](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/compare/41ee20d5d0755b6c62082ed60f8476c510d7f5bc...d41e010b9197ffc167c6c08cafa9321d5436754c). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/). Tired of seeing this sponsor message? :zap: `greenkeeper upgrade`
body_html:
Hello lovely humans,

redux-form just published its new version 6.0.2.

State Update 🚀
Dependency redux-form
New version 6.0.2
Type dependency

This version is not covered by your current version range.

Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though.

I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of redux-form.
Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update.

Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right?
Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work?

There is a collection of frequently asked questions and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. Let them know.

Good luck with your project ✨

You rock!

🌴

  • Bug fix involving submission error not being cleared. #1654 #1641 Thanks, @ortex!
  • Fixed issue with the jsnext:main build. #1671 #1637 Thanks, @NotWoods!
  • Added props to handleSubmit call. #1639 #1629 Thanks, @olistic!
  • Up to 5x performance gains when reading deep objects. #1667 Thanks, @smirea!
  • A lot of documentation clean-up by @kevinzwh.

Thanks for all your help, guys.

The new version differs by 595 commits .
